intro: Secamone stuhlmannii subsp. stuhlmannii, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a shrub or small tree native to tropical Africa, characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, white or yellowish flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional medicine.
